conclusion: Analyzing the thermodynamic process shown in the p-V diagram
State A: p ≈ 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 7 × 10⁻³ m³, T = 27°C = 300 K; State B: p ≈ 2.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 7 × 10⁻³ m³; State C: p ≈ 3.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 3 × 10⁻³ m³
For an ideal gas, the equation of state is PV = nRT
Using the ideal gas law, derive the relationship: (P_A V_A)/T_A = (P_C V_C)/T_C
Rearrange to solve for T_C: T_C = (P_C V_C)/(P_A V_A) × T_A
Substitute the values into the equation: T_C = (3.0 × 10^5 Pa × 3 × 10^{-3} m³)/(1.0 × 10^5 Pa × 7 × 10^{-3} m³) × 300 K
Convert from Kelvin to Celsius: T_C(°C) = T_C(K) - 273.15 = 112.56°C
The temperature of the gas in state C is approximately 112.6°C
